tables.dc:description: This table lists audio files which have been transcribed/annotated for DoReCo corpora. Note that only downloadable files are listed.

columns.dc:description: Date of recording. See also rec_date_assignment_certain.
columns.name: rec_date

columns.dc:description: Information on whether/how the audio has been annotated with glosses.
columns.name: gloss

columns.dc:description: Information on meta languages for which the annotations contain translations.
columns.name: transl

tables.dc:description: Some corpora in DoReCo contain data annotated with glosses. Such glossed data is extracted into a CLDF ExampleTable.

columns.dc:description: The example text in the source language.
columns.name: Primary_Text

columns.dc:description: The sequence of words of the primary text to be aligned with glosses
columns.name: Analyzed_Word

columns.dc:description: The sequence of glosses aligned with the words of the primary text
columns.name: Gloss

columns.dc:description: The translation of the example text in a meta language
columns.name: Translated_Text

columns.dc:description: References the language of the translated text
columns.name: Meta_Language_ID

columns.dc:description: The level of conformance of the example with the Leipzig Glossing Rules
columns.name: LGR_Conformance

columns.dc:description: Link to the audio file to which start and end markers pertain.
columns.name: File_ID

columns.dc:description: Start of the word in the linked sound file in (floating point) seconds.
columns.name: start

columns.dc:description: End of the word in the linked sound file in (floating point) seconds.
columns.name: end

columns.dc:description: Duration of the word in the linked sound file in (floating point) seconds.
columns.name: duration

tables.dc:description: Each DoReCo language corpus is listed as separate contribution in this table.

The ParameterTable lists IPA phones which appear in the DoReCo corpus (if a correspondence to the X-Sampa representation could be determined). If possible, IPA phones are linked to CLTS' BIPA representation, giving access to the CLTS feature system.

columns.dc:description: The IPA representation of the sound.
columns.name: Name

columns.dc:description: CLTS ID of the sound, i.e. the underscore-separated ordered list of features of the sound.
columns.name: CLTS_ID

columns.dc:description: Speaker age. See also age_assignment_certain.
columns.name: age

columns.dc:description: Speaker sex.
columns.name: sex

tables.dc:description: This table lists individual, time-aligned phones.

columns.dc:description: See the description of the Token_Type column.
columns.name: ph

columns.dc:description: Link to corresponding IPA phoneme, with details given in ParameterTable
columns.name: IPA

columns.dc:description: Utterance ID. Utterances are words/phones delimited by silent pauses.
columns.name: u_ID

columns.dc:description:
Not all rows in this table correspond to actual phones. If a row does the Token_Type is 'xsampa'
and the `ph` column holds the X-SAMPA representation of the phone, otherwise it is a 'pause' or a
'label'.

Labels consist of two opening brackets, the label proper, a closing bracket, the content (optional),
and another closing bracket, e.g. `<<ui>word>`. Labels may also appear on their own if the content
is not known, e.g. `<<ui>>`. Valid proper labels are

- fp: Filled pause
- fs: False start
- pr: Prolongation
- fm: Foreign material
- sg: Singing
- bc: Backchannel
- id: Ideophone
- on: Onomatopoeic
- wip: Word-internal pause
- ui: Unidentifiable

Silent pauses are marked by a special symbol, `<p:>`. The location of silent pauses is manually
checked by the DoReCo team, while the symbol itself is inserted by the WebMAUS service. Unlike
labels, the <p:> symbol has only one of each bracket, and no other content may be included in it.
columns.name: Token_Type

columns.dc:description: The word form transcribed into orthography.
columns.name: wd

columns.dc:description: Link to the audio file to which start and end markers pertain.
columns.name: File_ID

columns.dc:description: Start of the word in the linked sound file in (floating point) seconds.
